bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 193 (Wednesday, November 3, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SCHNEIDER:H.R. 5850.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8[Page H6179]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Worker and Family Support.
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text:
Impacts and Outcomes for Health Career Training Act

This bill requires the Department of Health and Human Services to study the impact of demonstration projects funded by grants for providing low-income individuals with education and training for health care occupations, including the effects of the projects on participants' employment and earnings.

bill.title: Impacts and Outcomes for Health Career Training Act

item.title: Impacts and Outcomes for Health Career Training Act
Impacts and Outcomes for Health Career Training Act
To ensure an evidence-based funding approach to study the effects of health profession opportunity grant demonstration projects, and to evaluate the demonstration projects.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Worker and Family Support.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
